newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-MARLINS PLACE RF GARY SHEFFIELD ON DISABLED LIST.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-MARLINS PLACE RF GARY SHEFFIELD ON DISABLED LIST.

text.p: The Florida Marlins on Friday placed star right fielder Gary Sheffield on the 15-day disabled list with a sprained left thumb after the injury failed to heal as quickly as anticipated.
Sheffield injured the thumb diving for a ball in the sixth inning of Tuesday's 11-5 win at Atlanta and he was disabled retroactive to Wednesday.
The three-time All-Star originally was expected to play Friday night against Pittsburgh, but still was experiencing swelling and pain in the thumb Thursday.
Sheffield is now expected to return to action May 29 at home against the Colorado Rockies, the Marlins said.

Sheffield, who signed a six-year, $61 million contract extension, hit a two-run homer in the third inning of Tuesday's win. He is batting only .223 with five homers and 16 RBI in 38 games, but has walked 38 times.
The 28-year-old Sheffield missed three months of the 1995 season after suffering torn ligaments in his right thumb while diving for a ball.
He set career highs with 42 homers and 120 RBI last season, leading the National League with an on-base percentage of .465 while batting .314 with 142 walks.

Florida (23-16), which is already playing without injured centre fielder Devon White and reserve outfielder/first baseman Cliff Floyd, trails Atlanta (26-13) by three games in the National League East.
